intro: Gnaphalium ferrugineum, commonly known as the rusty everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its small, yellowish flowers are surrounded by pale green bracts, and it produces fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Gnaphalium ferrugineum is often found in alpine and coastal regions, where it thrives in harsh environmental conditions.
